message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DB, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE 

This paper deals with distributed storage systems and databases, which are typically studied in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses consistency models, which are a key aspect of database systems and are studied in the Databases (cs.DB) sub-category. The paper uses formal methods to reason about the correctness of transactional programs, which is a topic studied in the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. The paper also discusses the reduction of the problem of checking robustness to a state reachability problem, which is a topic studied in the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of existing methods and tools for the verification of concurrent programs, which is a topic studied in the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
